meanings.definition: Of or relating to the radula.
meanings.sent1: The snail's radular structure helps it scrape food.
meanings.sent2: The radular teeth of the mollusk are used for feeding.
meanings.sent3: The radular design of the tool made it perfect for scraping off paint.
meanings.sent4: Her meticulous attention to detail was as radular as a snail's feeding mechanism.
meanings.sent5: The radular nature of the brush made it ideal for removing debris.

meanings.sent1: The radular snail navigated the terrain with ease.
meanings.sent2: The radular creature used its radula to grasp onto surfaces.
meanings.sent3: The radular pet's tongue was perfect for licking up spills.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was as radular as a snail's feeding organ.
meanings.sent5: The radular feature of the animal made it unique among its kind.

meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of a radula.
meanings.sent1: The tool had a radular appearance with its tiny ridges.
meanings.sent2: The radular pattern on the surface resembled a snail's radula.
meanings.sent3: The radular design of the fabric made it stand out.
meanings.sent4: His meticulous work ethic was as radular as a snail's feeding structure.
meanings.sent5: The radular texture of the material provided a unique feel.
